attributes.additional_details: This is just me though i cant imagine what its like for the other people on benefits in britain. Since all the cuts have happened my mum is now on about £60 for every two weeks. Is that really enough to fill our cupboards and fridge freezers? Is it enough to pay off the rent knowing thats 27 a week? Also with other bills gas, electricity? Its completely sick what theresa may and david cameron have yet what ever happened to “we are all in this together”
attributes.background: As i grew up my mum was on benefits trying hard to find a job whilst on about £300 every 2 weeks which was just enough for food, bills and even treats (clothes etc.) ever since conservatives have been in charge, its always has been a struggle. I have not had a decent meal since. Poverty is at a rise

rejection.details:
The Prime Minister of the UK is not chosen by the UK Government or Parliament.

After a general election, the Queen decides who to invite to form a Government. In practice, this is usually the leader of the political party that wins the most seats in a general election. You can find out more about this here:

http://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchUK/QueenandGovernment/QueenandPrimeMinister.aspx
